alert.note: Alert for Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 9:38PM MST until January 30 at 2:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero north of I-80, near 10 below zero I-80 corridor. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow resulting in snow covered roadways and reduced visibility along area roadways. * WHERE...Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains, especially areas north of I-80. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 7 PM this evening to noon MST Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 2 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions can be expected, especially north of I-80. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Those with travel plans through Monday afternoon along the SR-30 corridor should be prepared for snow covered roads and areas of blowing and drifting snow. Carry a winter survival kit as very cold wind chills in remote areas along SR-30 tonight into Monday morning will be dangerous in the event of vehicle trouble.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.

area.areaDesc: Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains
